column1: #Text=I loved Queen , Deep Purple , Pink Floyd , A-ha , Beatles ,
#Text=You were trained in classical piano at the Music Conservatory in Lviv .
#Text=How did the skills you learned while studying there impact your musical style now ?
#Text=: When I graduated from the conservatory , I obtained two educational qualifications in the field of music as a piano player and a symphonic orchestra conductor .
#Text=My music education helps me very much to create my own music .

#Text=For example , [ a ] few years ago at Lviv 's 750th anniversary , I performed " Energy Source " as conductor of a symphonic orchestra that played my own composed music in a beautiful light show .

column1: #Text=I interviewed Edsilia Rombley last month and she has a situation similar to yours , in that the main collaborator and producer of her music became her husband as well .
#Text=How did you meet your husband and what led you to form a musical partnership ?
#Text=Also , how did the two of you fall in love ?
#Text=: Both of us were born in Lviv .
#Text=We had the same friends , the same interest , objectives and the same love â€“ music .
#Text=I wanted to work with professionals and Sasha was [ a ] famous singer [ at ] that time in Lviv .
#Text=From the first second I understood that we have [ a ] kindred spirit .
#Text=And with our first song appeared our first feelings ...
#Text=When you first started receiving recognition and becoming successful in the Ukraine in the mid-1990s , was it overwhelming ?
#Text=What was your main motivation in your career during this time ? Was there ever a time where you considered leaving the music industry to live a quieter life ?
#Text=: No , I was born for music .
#Text=I love what I 'm doing with all of my heart .
#Text=The first thing [ about ] recognition [ is that ] I should be very truthful with myself and with people .
#Text=If you work only for money and you sing a song that you must sing but you do n't feel it all of your heart and soul â€“ you will be [ a ] singer for [ only ] one day .

#Text=Ruslana performing her song " Wild Dances , " in which she incorporates the musical styles of the Hutsul ethnic minority from the Carpathian Mountains in western Ukraine . ( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=In more than one project , including your Wild Dances CD , you have worked extensively in the unique musical tradition of the Hutsul people .
#Text=What caused you to pursue such a niche ?
#Text=Also , are there any important things about the Hutsul people and tradition that people may not know , that you wish you could bring awareness to ?
